verses.text: \sc The\sc* burden of the word of the \sc Lord\sc* to Israel by Malachi.
I have loved you, saith the \sc Lord\sc*. Yet ye say, Wherein hast thou loved us? \add Was\add* not Esau Jacobâ€™s brother? saith the \sc Lord\sc*: Yet I loved Jacob,
And I hated Esau, And laid his mountains and his heritage waste for the dragons of the wilderness.

Whereas Edom saith, We are impoverished, But we will return and build the desolate places; Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, They shall build, but I will throw down; And they shall call them, The border of wickedness, And, The people \add against\add* whom the \sc Lord\sc* hath indignation for ever.
And your eyes shall see, and ye shall say, The \sc Lord\sc* will be magnified from the border of Israel.

A son honoureth \add his\add* father, and a servant his master: If then I \add be\add* a father, where \add is\add* mine honour? And if I \add be\add* a master, where \add is\add* my fear? Saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts unto you, O priests, that despise my name. And ye say, Wherein have we despised thy name?
\add Ye\add* offer polluted bread upon mine altar; And ye say, Wherein have we polluted thee? In that ye say, The table of the \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* contemptible.

And if ye offer the blind for sacrifice, \add is it\add* not evil? And if ye offer the lame and sick, \add is it\add* not evil? Offer it now unto thy governor; Will he be pleased with thee, or accept thy person? saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts.
And now, I pray you, beseech God that he will be gracious unto us: This hath been by your means: Will he regard your persons? saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts.

Who \add is there\add* even among you that would shut the doors \add for nought?\add* Neither do ye kindle \add fire on\add* mine altar for nought. I have no pleasure in you, saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, Neither will I accept an offering at your hand.

For from the rising of the sun even unto the going down of the same My name \add shall be\add* great among the Gentiles; And in every place incense \add shall be\add* offered unto my name, and a pure offering: For my name \add shall be\add* great among the heathen, saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts.
But ye \add have\add* profaned it, in that ye say, The table of the \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* polluted; And the fruit thereof, \add even\add* his meat, \add is\add* contemptible.

Ye said also, Behold, what a weariness \add is it!\add* And ye have snuffed at it, saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts; And ye brought \add that which was\add* torn, and the lame, and the sick; Thus ye brought an offering: Should I accept this of your hand? saith the \sc Lord\sc*.

But cursed \add be\add* the deceiver, which hath in his flock a male, And voweth, and sacrificeth unto the Lord a corrupt \add thing:\add* For I \add am\add* a great King, saith the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts, And my name \add is\add* dreadful among the heathen.
